text: oh they're welcome to this our first
edition of Top Gear now if you happen to
be a road user let's face it who isn't
these days and I do hope you're going to
find something of special interest to
you in this new series now tonight we're
going to be taking a look at the way the
police can trap the speeding motorists
will be following the progress of our
own car on an economy run around Britain
and I'll be putting some questions to
the Minister of Transport William Rogers
but first let's meet the girl in the
news well usually when I leave the
Television Centre at the end of a three
day shift in London I get to the main
gates turn right and head west from my
home in them but today we've turned left
when we're heading on the m1 I don't
claim to be an expert driver or a
particularly good one but I do spend an
awful lot of my time driving I do cover
an awful lot of mass to give you some
idea I've had this car since you Daniel
second where now or by halfway through
April and I've already got just under
12,000 miles on the clock so giving some
ideas of a mileage that I do and like
most professional journalists and I
think of myself as a semi-professional
driver because we do spend an awful lot
of our working day in the car in my case
when I Drive up and down from my home in
Devon to the studio in London I'm in the
car for about four hours before I start
my day's work and even as a junior
reporter on newspapers when I first
started working for the BBC as a
reporter I could spend 2-3 hours of the
day and then in a car before I got to a
story and had to do a day's work and
then another two hours driving back to
the studio or back to the newspaper of
course being a woman driver I'm very
much aware of the fact that lady drivers
or lady drivers in the subject of music
horn jokes have been for years
but you know really if you think about
it there aren't men driving some women
drivers there are people who drive cars
some of those people are very good
drivers some of them are very very bad
and some of the bad drivers are men as
well as women
